title: RAG Survey: Comprehensive Review (Gao et al., 2024)
content:
This comprehensive survey categorizes RAG into three paradigms: Naive RAG, Advanced RAG, and Modular RAG.

THREE RAG PARADIGMS:
1. Naive RAG: Traditional indexing-retrieval-generation pipeline ("Retrieve-Read")
   - Challenges: retrieval precision/recall, hallucination, irrelevant context integration

2. Advanced RAG: Pre-retrieval and post-retrieval optimizations
   - Pre-retrieval: query rewriting, expansion, transformation, routing
   - Post-retrieval: re-ranking, context compression, selection

3. Modular RAG: Flexible component-based architecture
   - New modules: Search, RAG-Fusion, Memory, Routing, Predict, Task Adapter
   - Patterns: Rewrite-Retrieve-Read, Generate-Read, iterative/adaptive retrieval

KEY TECHNICAL COMPONENTS:

RETRIEVAL:
- Sources: Unstructured (text), Semi-structured (PDF), Structured (KG), LLM-generated content
- Granularity: Token → Phrase → Sentence → Proposition → Chunk → Document
- Indexing: Chunking strategies, metadata, hierarchical/KG indexes
- Query optimization: Multi-query expansion, sub-queries, HyDE, query rewriting
- Embeddings: Sparse (BM25) + Dense (BERT-based), hybrid retrieval
- Fine-tuning embedders with LLM supervision (REPLUG, LLM-Embedder)

GENERATION:
- Context curation: Re-ranking (Cohere, bge-reranker), compression (LLMLingua)
- LLM fine-tuning: Domain adaptation, RLHF alignment, knowledge distillation

AUGMENTATION PROCESSES:
- Iterative retrieval: Multiple retrieval cycles (ITER-RETGEN)
- Recursive retrieval: Hierarchical processing (RAPTOR)
- Adaptive retrieval: On-demand retrieval based on need (FLARE, Self-RAG)

EVALUATION:
- Metrics: Retrieval quality (context precision/recall), generation quality (faithfulness, relevance)
- Benchmarks: RGB, RECALL, CRUD-RAG
- Tools: RAGAS, ARES, TruLens
